image.altText: A graphic with 15 faces with the words 'Your Say'

props.synopsis: With the federal election campaign underway, we've spoken to 15 Tasmanians from across the state's five electorates to see what topics they most want to see addressed.

title.children: Your Say: What matters to Tasmanian voters this federal election?

image.altText: The exterior of a Coles shopfront

props.synopsis: More than 20 pre-packaged salad products are being recalled by two major supermarket retailers after Queensland's public health surveillance detected two products contaminated with a strain of E. coli.

title.children: Major supermarkets recall salad products due to contamination concerns

image.altText: A young boy with a gold shirt and a mullet plays a silver horn instrument as an older gentleman helps him follow the score.

props.synopsis: This northern Tasmanian band will celebrate its 146th birthday but with the average player aged in their 70s, the band is looking to secure its future. It's teamed up with a local primary school, offering free tuition in the hope some of the students will gain the skills to join in.

title.children: This brass band is offering free tuition to bring in a new generation

image.altText: Woman standing at podium delivering speech to crowd on Parliament lawns

props.synopsis: As the 30th anniversary looms for a debate that earned Tasmania a place in the world record books, three people who took part reflect on the marathon effort.

title.children: All-hours debate over 29 days snared Tasmania a world record in the 90s

image.altText: Salmon farm location map 4

props.synopsis: If you've travelled along Tasmania's coastline, you may have spotted collections of black circular pens floating just offshore and thought 'what are those?' They're salmon farms — and there is a lot of them.

title.children: How many salmon farms are there in Tasmania — and who owns them

image.altText: Colourful pencils on a desk in a childcare centre.

props.synopsis:
Imagine having to book a childcare place not just before your baby is born but before it's even conceived.

That's what some families in Tassie are resorting to. 

Along with the rest of the nation a myriad of issues plague the industry intended to care for our nation's most precious assets. 

Will politicians promises to ease the cost of access to childcare be enough to solve the industry’s broader woes?

Featuring the ABC's Families reporter Fiona Blackwood.

Get in touch, email us: tassiecast@abc.net.au

title.children: Can election promises fix Tassie childcare crisis?

image.altText: A woman with short hair smiles with a bull terrier resting its head on her lap in a living room with white shelving.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian state law has the weakest protections for people relying on assistance animals, and discrimination reports are growing. Those affected say considering legal action to access public spaces and necessary services is exhausting.

title.children: 'Incredibly outdated' assistance dog laws leaving people in limbo

image.altText: Eight Race Around the World contestants posing for a group shot, blue background.

props.synopsis: The untold stories from behind the scenes of Race Around the World, the show that launched John Safran and became one of the 90s most unlikely hits.

title.children: 'We could have died': Inside the insanity of an unlikely 90s TV hit

image.altText: A close-up of Donald Trump wearing a white shirt, blue suit jacket and yellow tie

props.synopsis: The US president has issued an unusually critical assessment of Vladimir Putin, saying he was angered when the Russian president criticised Volodymyr Zelenskyy's leadership.

title.children: Trump says he's 'pissed off' with Putin, threatens oil tariffs on Russia

image.altText: A woman sitting at a round dining table holds a photo of her late adult brother.

props.synopsis: Australia's corporate watchdog calls on superannuation funds to overhaul the way they deal with death benefit insurance claims, noting excessive delays, poor customer service and ineffective claims handling.

title.children: ASIC's scathing review of super funds finds 'genuine suffering'

image.altText: A portrait of Rob Halliday looking sombre, standing in front of a rocky shore.

props.synopsis: The level of violence faced by school leaders is the worst it's ever been, with both students and their parents reportedly making threats, according to a long-running survey of more than 2,000 principals.

title.children: 'A tragic loss': Warning large number of principals could quit amid violence

image.altText: man with faded red bucket hat, navy tshirt holds steering wheel inside tractor cabin with 4 young boys, 2 seated on each side

props.synopsis: In Australia the Crown owns all resources under the ground, regardless of who owns the property. Therefore the Byrne family face a lengthy and costly legal battle with limited prospects of success.

title.children: Fifth-generation farming family determined to protect their land from miners

image.altText: A man adjusts his tie as he looks at a journalist who sits opposite him

props.synopsis: At this time last year, David Speirs was adamant his position as SA Liberal leader was "100 per cent secure". But the past 12 months have brought almost nothing other than challenges for the now 40-year-old, who last week stood in the dock.

title.children: David Speirs has gone from '100 per cent secure' to a guilty plea

image.altText: Brian Mier, dressed in short-sleeved shirt, examines a large lump on his arm.

props.synopsis: Victoria's planned surgery waitlist has been growing again, with warnings many are still languishing in a "hidden" queue in the state's complex health system.

title.children: As Victoria's surgery waitlist grows, so do concerns over a 'hidden' queue

image.altText: A supermarket aisle with shelves of rice being advertised as half-price.

props.synopsis: The details of a price gouging ban would only be decided after an election, but there are precedents to draw on.

title.children: Examining Labor's promise to ban supermarkets from price gouging

image.altText: A man with red hair and a red beard wearing a suit and a woman with black plaited hair and dark skin holding her chin in hand

props.synopsis: Prince Harry faces explosive bullying allegations as he walks away from the charity he founded in his mother’s name.

title.children: 'Number one risk': Sentebale chair strikes back against Prince Harry

image.altText: tnoga islands

props.synopsis: The US Tsunami Warning Centre earlier warned waves were possible within 300 kilometres of the epicentre, which struck approximately 100 kilometres off the coast of Tonga.

title.children: Tsunami threat cancelled after magnitude-7.1 earthquake hits Tonga

image.altText: anthony albanese holds a baby and smiles for a photo

props.synopsis: Modelling shows Labor ahead in 10 seats where it was behind six weeks ago, putting it in a stronger position to form government.

title.children: Labor pulls ahead in poll that had Dutton in front six weeks ago

image.altText: richard chamberlain

props.synopsis: The American actor boasted a six decade-career that spanned theatre, films and television.

title.children: Heartthrob actor Richard Chamberlain, star of The Thorn Birds, dies aged 90

image.altText: A young adult man wearing a broad brimmed hat looking over the ocean

props.synopsis: Young men across the world have been embracing right-wing politics, while young women have moved to the left. Will it happen in the Australian election too?

title.children: Young men are flocking to right-wing politicians overseas. In Australia there's 'a twist'

image.altText: compositie of a man and ocean wind turbines

props.synopsis: An anti-wind farm activist group has been accused of "Trumpian-style" attacks on experts and spreading misinformation and conspiracy theories in marginal Labor seats ahead of the May 3 election.

title.children: 'Won't back down': Inside the anti-wind farm crusade threatening Labor seats

image.altText: A market stall is set up in front of a badly damaged building in Gaza.

props.synopsis: The Hamas militant group says it has accepted a new Gaza ceasefire proposal from mediators Egypt and Qatar, but Israel says it has made a counter-proposal in "full coordination" with the third mediator, the United States.

title.children: Hamas accepts Gaza ceasefire proposal, but Israel makes counteroffer

image.altText: A man in a light denim jacket stands near media at the construction site

props.synopsis: As Pornsak Seingsing ran for his life out of a collapsing high-rise building in Bangkok, he could hear terrified cries at his back.

title.children: As a building collapsed in Bangkok, this worker ran for his life: 'I was the last one'

image.altText: A couple on a scooter rides past a collapsed shrine

props.synopsis: Myanmar's shadow National Unity Government, which coordinates the popular struggle against the ruling military, announces a unilateral partial ceasefire to facilitate earthquake relief efforts.

title.children: 'Nothing short of incredible': Air strikes continue after earthquake in Myanmar

image.altText: Anthony Albanese on Insiders

props.synopsis: In his first major interview of the campaign, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says he would be willing to direct gas companies to secure more supplies for Australia if needed, but has downplayed the need for dedicated gas reservation laws as proposed by the Coalition.

title.children: Albanese willing to direct gas exporters to supply Australia 'if needed'

image.altText: a portrait of a man on a street

props.synopsis: Joakim Medin was detained in Istanbul as part of an investigation launched after a protest in Stockholm in January 2023, where a mannequin resembling President Erdoğan was hung outside the city hall.

title.children: Swedish journalist arrested over alleged terror ties, Turkish authorities say

image.altText: An excavator constructing a levee to keep out flood water.

props.synopsis: Queensland Premier David Crisafulli warned many communities "are yet to see the worst" of flooding due to the volume of water in catchments across outback Queensland.

title.children: Flooded western Queensland has 'choppers everywhere', levee banks spilling

image.altText: Caleb Serong smiles while wearing the Glendinning-Allan Medal

props.synopsis: Fremantle dominates Western Derby 60 and runs out 38-point winners over a poor West Coast, with Caleb Serong winning his fourth Glendinning-Allan Medal, after Adelaide saw off North Melbourne to remain unbeaten.

title.children: Serong ties derby record as Dockers dominate Eagles in battle of the west

image.altText: Daly Cherry-Evans of the Sea Eagles passing the ball to his left, with defenders approaching him

props.synopsis: Daly Cherry-Evans claims he has been the victim of an "ugly and nasty" smear campaign, but says fans showed they saw through it during Manly's 26-12 defeat of Parramatta.

title.children: Cherry-Evans claims he is the victim of an 'ugly and nasty' smear campaign

image.altText: sketch of a woman with red hair holding binoculars to her face with silhouettes of birds in the lens

props.synopsis: Since 1959 the avian flu virus H5N1 has been popping up around the globe. Now scientists believe it could spark the next pandemic.

title.children: This flu virus is spreading and scientists say it has pandemic potential

image.altText: A man looks at orange flames.

props.synopsis: More than a dozen fires have been fanned by high winds and dry conditions, killing at least 28 people and burning more than 48,000 hectares of forest, the worst of its kind recorded in the country.

title.children: South Korean police say deadly wildfire may have been caused by rite at family grave

image.altText: Dutton protester

props.synopsis: Politicians say hecklers who gatecrashed Anthony Albanese's and Peter Dutton's campaign events will make it harder for them to interact with ordinary Australians.

title.children: Politicians urge 'ratbags' to stay away after hecklers gatecrash campaigns

props.synopsis: Almost all of us have eaten Tasmanian farmed salmon at some point, so why has it become so contentious ahead of the federal election?

title.children: Understanding the Tasmanian salmon saga
